result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order of Commitment for Treatment 
(incompetency)
DECLINED DOC

9:04 AM Defendant Mark Alan Flood in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Mark Alan Flood.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Kohl requests an inpatient commitment for up to 12 months. The Court accepts the report. Atty Ocwieja and the DE do not object. The Court orders the DE be committed for treatment for a period up to 12 months. The Clerk is to prepare and file Order for Competency Examination. No further proceedings set at this time. Counsel are to contact the Judges Office if a hearing is needed.

10:00 AM Defendant Mark Alan Flood not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Mark Alan Flood.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Evauluation was not able to be completed by this date and requests more time. Matter set over.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:07 AM Defendant Mark Alan Flood in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Mark Alan Flood.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ocwieja requests that there be a competency evaluation. ADA Kohl has no objections. The Court grants the requests for Inpatient competency evaluation. The Court finds the preliminary hearings time limits are to be waived.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:34 AM Defendant Mark Alan Flood in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Mark Alan Flood.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ocwieja states that the defendant refuses to speak to him and raises an issue of either competency or with himself. The Court addresses the DE. The defendant holds up a sign that states "I stand mute". The defendant speaks in regards to his attorney and decides to continue with him as his counsel. Matter set to proceed to the preliminary hearing on 8/31.
Clerk emailed Warrant cancelation to court info at GCSD.

1:18 PM Defendant Mark Alan Flood appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Kohl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. The Court directs the warrant to be vacated. Bond to be reinstated. Matter set over for Status on 08-24-2022 at 11:30 AM and for a preliminary hearing on 08-31-2022.
Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:18 PM Defendant Mark Alan Flood not in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Mark Alan Flood. Witness is present. Attorney Kohl requests a bench warrant to issue. The Court orders a bench warrant to issue, body only statewide.
